data.title: 50 Facts About Brad Garrett
data.meta_description: Discover 50 intriguing facts about Brad Garrett, the acclaimed actor and comedian known for his towering stature, booming voice, and memorable roles in hit TV shows and movies.
data.text:
Early Life

Brad Garrett was born on April 14, 1960, in Woodland Hills, California. He showed an interest in comedy from a young age, often making his family and friends laugh with his witty remarks and impressions.

Height

Standing at an impressive 6 feet 8 inches (203 cm) tall, Brad Garrett’s height makes him one of the tallest actors in Hollywood.

First Stand-Up Performance

At the age of 16, Brad Garrett performed his first stand-up comedy routine at a local nightclub. The experience ignited his passion for comedy, leading him to pursue a career in the entertainment industry.

Comedy Club Circuit

Before achieving fame on television, Brad Garrett honed his comedic skills by performing at various comedy clubs across the country, including The Improv and The Comedy Store.

Raymond Barone

Brad Garrett gained widespread recognition for his role as Robert Barone, the lovable but often overshadowed older brother of Ray Barone, in the hit sitcom “Everybody Loves Raymond.” His impeccable comedic timing and memorable catchphrases made him a fan favorite.

Emmy Wins

For his portrayal of Robert Barone, Brad Garrett won three Primetime Emmy Awards for Outstanding Supporting Actor in a Comedy Series in 2002, 2003, and 2005.

Voice Acting

Brad Garrett has lent his distinctive voice to various animated characters, most notably voicing Eeyore in Disney’s “Winnie the Pooh” franchise. His deep, gravelly voice adds a unique charm to his animated roles.

Film Appearances

Brad Garrett has appeared in a number of films throughout his career, including “Finding Nemo,” “Night at the Museum,” and “Tangled,” showcasing his versatility as an actor.

Broadway Debut

In 2013, Brad Garrett made his Broadway debut in the revival of Neil Simon’s play “The Odd Couple,” starring alongside Nathan Lane.

Hosting Game Shows

Brad Garrett has also showcased his hosting skills, serving as the host of various game shows, such as “Family Feud” and “The Kids Are Alright.

Poker Enthusiast

Brad Garrett is an avid poker player and has participated in numerous celebrity poker tournaments, often showcasing his skills at the table.

Voice of Hulk Hogan

In the animated series “Hulk Hogan’s Rock ‘n’ Wrestling,” Brad Garrett provided the voice for the legendary wrestler Hulk Hogan.

Stand-Up Comedy Special

Brad Garrett filmed his own stand-up comedy special, titled “Brad Garrett: Isn’t It Enough?” which premiered on Comedy Central in 2019.

Charity Work

Brad Garrett is actively involved in various charitable organizations, supporting causes such as autism awareness and children’s hospitals.

Las Vegas Residency

In recent years, Brad Garrett has had a residency at the MGM Grand in Las Vegas, performing his hilarious stand-up routine to sold-out crowds.

“Til Death”

Following the success of “Everybody Loves Raymond,” Brad Garrett starred in the sitcom “Til Death” alongside Joely Fisher, which aired from 2006 to 2010.

Deep Voice

Brad Garrett’s deep, resonant voice has made him a sought-after voice actor, lending his talents to characters in numerous animated films and television shows.

Garrett’s Comedy Club

Brad Garrett opened his own comedy club, appropriately named “Garrett’s Comedy Club,” in Las Vegas, providing a platform for emerging and established comedians.

Guest Appearances

Brad Garrett has made guest appearances on various television shows, including “Law & Order: SVU,” “Frasier,” and “The Tonight Show with Jay Leno.

Love Life

Brad Garrett was previously married to Jill Diven, and the couple has two children together. They divorced in 2008.

Voice of Hook Hand

In Disney’s animated series “Rapunzel’s Tangled Adventure,” Brad Garrett provided the voice for the character Hook Hand.

“I Kid with Brad Garrett”

Brad Garrett served as the executive producer and host of the reality TV series “I Kid with Brad Garrett,” which showcased the talents of young children.

Impersonation of Jerry Seinfeld

Audiences have been delighted by Brad Garrett’s spot-on impersonation of comedian Jerry Seinfeld, a tribute to his friendship with the “Seinfeld” star.

Stand-Up Comedy Tours

Brad Garrett has embarked on several successful stand-up comedy tours, captivating audiences with his hilarious observations and relatable humor.

“Gleason”

Brad Garrett delivered a critically acclaimed performance as Jackie Gleason in the television biopic “Gleason,” showcasing his dramatic acting chops.

Poker Tournament Victories

Brad Garrett has achieved success in various poker tournaments, winning the Las Vegas Ante Up For Africa Charity Tournament and the World Series of Poker’s Omaha Hi-Lo Split Championship.

Celebrity impressions

Brad Garrett is known for his exceptional celebrity impressions, with impersonations of personalities such as Marlon Brando, Casey Kasem, and James Gandolfini.

“The Crazy Ones”

Brad Garrett guest-starred on the comedy series “The Crazy Ones” alongside Robin Williams, reuniting with his fellow comedian and friend.

Voice of Dim

In the animated film “A Bug’s Life,” Brad Garrett provided the voice of Dim, one of the loyal ant characters.

Web Series

Brad Garrett appeared in the web series “The Pursuit of Happyness” as a therapist and offered comedic insights to his patients.

Autobiographical Book

Brad Garrett released an autobiography titled “When the Balls Drop,” in which he shares personal stories and reflections on his life and career.

“How to Live with Your Parents (For the Rest of Your Life)”

Brad Garrett had a recurring role in the sitcom “How to Live with Your Parents (For the Rest of Your Life)” as Elaine’s ex-husband, Gregg.

Celebrity Family Feud

Brad Garrett competed on the game show “Celebrity Family Feud” with his real-life family, showcasing their humor and camaraderie.

Voice of Gusteau

In Disney-Pixar’s “Ratatouille,” Brad Garrett provided the voice for the character Auguste Gusteau, the renowned chef.

Stand-Up Comedy Albums

Brad Garrett has released two stand-up comedy albums, “Brad Garrett: Live” in 2013, and “Brad Garrett: Why Pay More?” in 2015.

“Fargo”

Brad Garrett had a recurring role in the hit television series “Fargo” in its third season, portraying the character Joe Bulo.

Political Activism

Brad Garrett is known for his involvement in various political causes and has actively supported candidates and campaigns throughout the years.

Voice of Hulk

In the animated series “The Incredible Hulk,” Brad Garrett provided the voice for the character Bruce Banner.

“Music and Lyrics”

Brad Garrett appeared in the romantic comedy film “Music and Lyrics” alongside Hugh Grant and Drew Barrymore, showcasing his versatility as an actor.

Television Director

Brad Garrett made his directorial debut on the television series “Everybody Loves Raymond,” and has since directed episodes of various other shows.

Stand-Up Comedy Specials

Brad Garrett has filmed multiple stand-up comedy specials, including “Brad Garrett: Live on the Strip” and “Brad Garrett: Maximum Capacity.

“Elephant in the Room”

Brad Garrett released a stand-up comedy special titled “Brad Garrett: Elephant in the Room,” showcasing his candid and hilarious take on life.

Voice of Frankenstein

In the animated series “Monster Mash,” Brad Garrett provided the voice for the classic monster character Frankenstein.

“Sweet and Lowdown”

Brad Garrett had a supporting role in Woody Allen’s film “Sweet and Lowdown” alongside Sean Penn and Samantha Morton.

“The Pacifier”

Brad Garrett appeared in the action-comedy film “The Pacifier,” starring Vin Diesel, showcasing his ability to seamlessly transition between comedic and dramatic roles.

Voice of Chug

In Disney-Pixar’s “Planes” franchise, Brad Garrett provided the voice for the character Chug, Dusty Crophopper’s loyal friend.

Late Night TV Appearances

Brad Garrett has made appearances on various late-night talk shows, including “The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon” and “Conan.”

“I’m Dying Up Here”

Brad Garrett had a recurring role in the television series “I’m Dying Up Here,” a drama set in the world of stand-up comedy in the 1970s.

“Tangled: The Series”

Brad Garrett reprised his role as Hook Hand in the animated series “Tangled: The Series,” further expanding the character’s story.

Legacy and Influence

Brad Garrett has left a lasting impact on the world of comedy, inspiring aspiring comedians with his unique style and paving the way for tall actors with his towering presence and talent.

These 50 facts about Brad Garrett provide a glimpse into the life and career of this extraordinary actor and comedian. From his iconic role in “Everybody Loves Raymond” to his successful stand-up comedy career, Brad Garrett continues to delight audiences with his comedic genius. Whether on screen, stage, or behind the microphone, Brad Garrett’s talent and larger-than-life personality have made him a beloved figure in the entertainment industry.

Conclusion

In conclusion, Brad Garrett is an incredibly talented and versatile actor who has left an indelible mark on the entertainment industry. With his towering height and distinctive deep voice, he has captivated audiences in both comedic and dramatic roles. From his breakthrough performance as Robert Barone in “Everybody Loves Raymond” to his incredible voice work in animated films like “Finding Nemo,” Garrett has proven time and time again that he is a force to be reckoned with.Beyond his acting career, Garrett is also known for his philanthropic efforts, using his platform to support various charitable organizations. With his larger-than-life personality and natural comedic timing, it’s no wonder that he has become a beloved figure in the world of entertainment.From his humble beginnings to his countless accolades, Brad Garrett’s journey is a testament to his dedication and passion for his craft. With his unmistakable talent and charismatic presence, we can’t wait to see what he has in store for us next.

A: Brad Garrett was born on April 14, 1960.

Q: How tall is Brad Garrett?

A: Brad Garrett stands at an impressive 6 feet 8 inches tall.

Q: What is Brad Garrett’s most famous role?

A: Brad Garrett is best known for his role as Robert Barone in the hit sitcom “Everybody Loves Raymond.”

Q: Has Brad Garrett won any awards?

A: Yes, Brad Garrett has won several prestigious awards, including three Primetime Emmy Awards for Outstanding Supporting Actor in a Comedy Series for his portrayal of Robert Barone.

Q: Is Brad Garrett married?

A: Brad Garrett was previously married to Jill Diven from 1999 to 2007. He is currently engaged to IsaBeall Quella.

Q: What other projects has Brad Garrett been a part of?

A: In addition to “Everybody Loves Raymond,” Brad Garrett has appeared in numerous television shows and films, including “Tangled,” “Ratatouille,” and “Finding Nemo.”

A: While specific details about upcoming projects are not currently known, Brad Garrett continues to be active in the entertainment industry and fans can expect to see more from him in the future.
